items.title: BBC Bitesize - What are viruses and malware?
items.htmlTitle: BBC Bitesize - What are viruses and malware?
items.snippet:
If you're unlucky, your computer could be infected with a virus or malware. These 
programs ... Computing. Viruses and malware are programs that can attack 
computers, tablets, phones and other digital devices. ... By combining the words '
malicious' (meaning 'harmful') and 'software' we get the word 'malware'. Viruses 
are ...

metatags.og:title: What are viruses and malware?
metatags.twitter:description: If you’re unlucky, your computer could be infected with a virus or malware. These programs attack your device, stopping it from running or stealing your data.

items.title: Quiz: Malware - Quiz from WhatIs.com
items.snippet:
So many kinds of malware in the wild From garden variety worms to hybrid 
viruses youve got to watch out for Trojan horses spyware and social engineering.
.. ... _____This is malicious coding that combines virus' ability to alter program 
code with the worm's ability to reside in live memory and to propagate without 
any action ...

items.title: Malware 101: An Overview Of Malware Types - Joseph Steinberg
items.htmlTitle: Malware 101: An Overview Of Malware Types - Joseph Steinberg
items.snippet:
Malware is an all-encompassing term that includes many forms of intentionally 
malicious software (in fact, the word malware was first coined in 1990 by the ... 
Blended malware is malware that utilizes multiple types of malware technology 
as part of an attack – for example, combining features of Trojans, worms, and 
viruses.

metatags.og:description: Most businesspeople today are familiar with the term malware – that is, malicious software of some sort – but, in recent months I have heard multiple otherwise knowledgeable people misuse various terms related to malware types, so I decided to share a short primer that should be useful for people of all backgrounds: Malware Malware […]

items.title: Honeypot (computing) - Wikipedia
items.snippet:
In computer terminology, a honeypot is a computer security mechanism set to 
detect, deflect, or, in some manner, counteract attempts at unauthorized use of 
information systems. Generally, a honeypot consists of data that appears to be a 
legitimate part of the site, but is actually isolated and monitored, and that seems 
to ...

items.title: Rootkit - Wikipedia
items.snippet:
A root kit is a collection of computer software, typically malicious, designed to 
enable access to a computer or areas of its software that is not otherwise allowed 
and often masks its existence or the existence of other software. The term rootkit 
is a concatenation of "root" (the traditional name of the privileged account on ...

items.title: Glossary of Cybersecurity Terms - Scott Schober
items.snippet:
Definition: A program that specializes in detecting and blocking or removing 
forms of spyware. Related Term(s): spyware. antivirus software. Definition: A 
program that monitors a computer or network to detect or identify major types of 
malicious code and to prevent or contain malware incidents. Sometimes by 
removing or ...
